article_title: Photos: Dhaka, a Megacity Split in Two
article_text:
Dhaka, established 400 years ago on the river Buriganga, is now a megacity. But infrastructure and services have not kept pace with the city's growth. Syed Zakir Hossain for The Wall Street Journal …

Politicians in Bangladesh's National Parliament House decided to split Dhaka in 2011. The split is likely to be an issue in elections slated for January. Syed Zakir Hossain for The Wall Street Journal …

Dhaka's population has mushroomed in recent years and some residents say they are still unsure in which city they live. Syed Zakir Hossain for The Wall Street Journal …

Inequality between the richer north and the poorer south may become more apparent. Syed Zakir Hossain for The Wall Street Journal …

A lack of coordination between the two sides has slowed some infrastructure projects in the city. Syed Zakir Hossain for The Wall Street Journal …

twitter.description: Established 400 years ago on the banks of the River Buriganga, Dhaka's infrastructure is struggling to keep pace with the city's population boom.
